pacs 0.2.3
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Validate the library.

Source: R/valid.R
lib_validate.Rd

Compare current and expected packages under .libPaths. Checking the healthy of the library, which packages are newest one. Optionally added life duration of each package.

lib_validate(
  lib.loc = NULL,
  fields = c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo"),
  lifeduration = FALSE,
  is_red = FALSE
)

Arguments

lib.loc

character. Default: NULL
fields

character vector with possible values c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo", "Suggests"). Default: c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo")
lifeduration

logical if to add life duration column, might take some time. Default: FALSE
is_red

logical if to add R CRAN check page status, any WARNING or ERROR will give TRUE. Default FALSE

Value

data.frame with 5/7 columns Package Version.expected.min Version.have. "" means newest version.

Note

Version.expected.min column not count packages which are not a dependency for any package, so could not be find in DESCRIPTION files.

Examples

lib_validate()
#>         Package Version.expected.min Version.have version_status newest
#> 1    KernSmooth                 <NA>      2.23-20              1   TRUE
#> 2          MASS                            7.3-54              1   TRUE
